title: This guy blew $1.6m lotto win
text:
Share on Twitter 
A BUILDER who shot to fame after winning £1 million ($1.6 million) in a British TV lottery has allegedly been caught stealing after blowing the lot. 
Nathan Hageman, 37 is on trial accused of breaking into a client’s home and stealing £8000 ($13,000) from a safe. 
His mate, Nathan Taylor, has admitted to burglary and converting criminal property in relation to the same incident but Hageman has denied all charges. 
Jurors at Reading Crown Court were told Hageman was identified by a distinctive tattoo visible on the backside of one of two men caught on CCTV scaling a ladder into the Berkshire property. 
“You can’t see it very well but there is a tattoo on the man at the top of the ladder’s bottom,” Prosecutor John Evison said , according to The Mirror. 
“It looks suspiciously like the one on Mr Hageman’s right bottom. Inside the premises you can see the defendant taking away the safe but it is not possible to see their faces.” 
Mr Evison told the court that Hageman turned to a life of crime after spending all his winnings on fast cars and luxury holidays. He bought a Mazda sports car just 24 hours after raid, the court heard. Nathan Hageman (second from left) with former fiancee Jane Makepeace and Red or Black hosts Ant and Dec after his 2011 win. Source: Supplied 
Hageman made world headlines in 2011 when he became the first winner of Simon Cowell’s roulette game show Red or Black . It was hosted by popular duo Ant and Dec and watched by an estimated eight million people. 
Things started to go pear-shaped for the tradesman just a few months later when his former fiancee Jane Makepeace revealed he had thrown her out of his new penthouse. 
“I thought the money would make Nathan a better person because he wouldn’t have to struggle to get by, but it has just made him worse than ever,” she told The Mirror at the time. Nathan Hageman leaves ITV’s London studios with former fiancee Jane Makepeace following a guest appearance on the ‘This Morning’ show. Picture: Simon Earl / Splash News Source: Splash News Australia 
Her eviction came on the heels of a massive spending spree by Hageman, in which he blew £65,000 (AUD50,000) on a souped up Range Rover, a Peugeot, a BMW, an Armani watch and a 10-day holiday in Cuba in a matter of weeks. 
Hageman became even more unpopular after it emerged he had been jailed for a violent attack on ex-girlfriend Amy Edwards in 2006, serving two-and-a-half years of a five-year sentence. 
He then tried to win back public affection by vowing to use his prize money to turn his life around, revealing a troubled past that included being made homeless at the age of 11. 
The promise proved to be short-lived, however. In 2014, Hageman was jailed for four months after bombarding a woman with 400 abusive text messages in 48 hours. 
The trial at Reading Crown Court continues.
